detaileddescription.para: Production code should set this to xI2S_DEBUG. To enable debug mode rename the define to I2S_DEBUG.
At least three elements must exist for good flow in driver
PDM block overhead size in number of bytes > sizeof(PDMCC26XX_I2S_QueueNode)
Return code when PDMCC26XX_I2S_control() was successful.
Return code when a I2S command or function is undefined/not-implemented.
Return code when PDMCC26XX_I2S_control() was unsuccessful.
Generic macro for disabled
Generic macro for enabled

We don't use sample stamp generator, but we can't start without enabling it and configuring the trigger. This is because the trigger also starts the audio stream Since we don't use it we keep the word period at its max 2^16 For the driverlib which runs a modulo on the word period we can set the modulo to 0xFFFF to avoid issues with division by zero.
Definitions for different I2S Word Clock phase settings.

Defines how WCLK division ratio is calculated to generate different duty cycles.
I2SWCLKDIV.WDIV
Macro
Value
PDMCC26XX_I2S_WordClockPhase_Single
0
PDMCC26XX_I2S_WordClockPhase_Dual
1
PDMCC26XX_I2S_WordClockPhase_UserDefined
2
Definitions to set sample edge
Definitions different I2S Word Clock source settings.
Definitions different I2S Bit Clock source settings.
Definitions to either invert I2S word or bit clock or not
PDMCC26XX_I2S Audio Data Pin Usage.
PDMCC26XX_I2S Audio Channel Masks.
PDMCC26XX_I2S data word length is used to determine how bits to transfer per word.

entry.para: A typical transfer length is 16 bits

detaileddescription.para: PDMCC26XX_I2S Phase is set to select Dual or Single phase format
PDMCC26XX_I2S Sample Edge is set to control what edge to sample and clock out data on.
PDMCC26XX_I2S data word size is used to determine how to configure the I2S data transfers to/from memory.

Macro
Value
Usage
PDMCC26XX_I2S_MemLen16bit
0
sample 16 bits per word
PDMCC26XX_I2S_MemLen24bit
1
sample 24 bits per word
PDMCC26XX_I2S_MemLen16bit: sample 16 bits per word PDMCC26XX_I2S_MemLen24bit: sample 24 bits per word
PDMCC26XX_I2S Data Delay, which translates into format (LJF, I2S/DSP, RJF).

This field can be set to any 8 bit value. The macros are just defined for convenience. Left justified mode means that sampling should start immediately. For right justified mode the data delay depends on how many samples should be taken per word. It is an alignment.
I2S is a special mode that defines that no sample occur on first edge, hence there is one period data delay.
Mask to use with PDMCC26XX_I2S_AudioPinConfig.driverLibParams when calling DriverLib.
Idle mode. Stream not started
Stream started, no buffer yet available
Unused state.
PDMCC26XX_I2S_startStream() called while stream is already running
No pointer available when one was expected, meaning the driver failed to provide new pointer and PDMCC26XX_I2S_stopStream() was not called
Buffer ready, either IN or OUT or both, whichever are expected
A new buffer is ready but the old ones were not processed in time. The oldest buffer was dropped to provide space for newer data.
PDMCC26XX_I2S_stopStream() is called, a graceful shutdown procedure is started
Driver transitioned from Stopping to Stopped state during graceful shutdown. Now a pointer error is expected, and upon it a semaphore is set allowing PDMCC26XX_I2S_stopStream() to return
PDMCC26XX_I2S_stopStream() was called, but driver timed out trying to gracefully shutdown

briefdescription.para: Status codes that are set by the I2S driver.

detaileddescription.para: PDMCC26XX_I2S in PDM microphone mode
PDMCC26XX_I2S in I2S mode

briefdescription.para: Definitions for various PDMCC26XX_I2S modes of operation.

detaileddescription.para: PDMCC26XX_I2S_requestBuffer() blocks execution. This mode can only be used when called within a Task context.
PDMCC26XX_I2S_requestBuffer returns immediately if no buffer is available. The caller is notified through events each time a buffer is available. This mode can be used in a Task, Swi, or Hwi context.
The application must not access any member variables of this structure!

briefdescription.para: PDMCC26XX_I2S_MallocFxn is a function pointer for the malloc function to be used by the driver.
PDMCC26XX_I2S_FreeFxn is a function pointer for the free function to be used by the driver. This is needed for memory clean up, if something goes wrong.
A handle that is returned from a PDMCC26XX_I2S_open() call.

detaileddescription.para: Number of samples (16 or 24 bits) per queue element buffer
These fields are used by the driver to set up the I2S module

A sample structure is shown below (single PDM microphone): constPDMCC26XX_I2S_AudioPinConfigPDMCC26XX_I2Sobjects[]={ PDMCC26XX_I2S_ADUsageDisabled, 0, 0, 0, 0, PDMCC26XX_I2S_ADUsageInput, 0, 1, 2, I2S_MONO_MODE };

briefdescription.para: The definition of a callback function used when wakeup on chip select is enabled.
Function to open a given CC26XX I2S peripheral specified by the I2S handle.

detaileddescription.para: The function will set a dependency on its power domain, i.e. power up the module and enable the clock. The IOs are allocated. The I2S will not be enabled.
params must point a correctly initialized PDMCC26XX_I2S_Params struct.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a parameter block, if NULL it will use default values

simplesect.para: A PDMCC26XX_I2S_Handle on success or a NULL on an error or if it has been already opened

briefdescription.para: Function to close a given CC26XX I2S peripheral specified by the I2S handle.

detaileddescription.para: Will disable the I2S, disable all I2S interrupts and release the dependency on the corresponding power domain. It will also destroy all semaphores and queues that have been used.

simplesect.para: PDMCC26XX_I2S_open() has to be called first.

briefdescription.para: Function for starting an I2S interface.

detaileddescription.para: Calling this function will prevent the device from sleeping, as the stream is continuous and thus require power to the audio interface module from start to end. This function will configure all hardware registers that does not have retention. Hence, one may call PDMCC26XX_I2S_open then go to sleep before this function is called.
If non-blocking mode is selected then the PDMCC26XX_I2S module will begin calling the provided callback function every time a new buffer is ready.

simplesect.para: PDMCC26XX_I2S_open() has to be called first.

parameterdescription.para: An I2S handle returned from PDMCC26XX_I2S_open()

simplesect.para: True if transfer is successful and false if not

briefdescription.para: Function for stopping an I2S interface.

detaileddescription.para: This function will initiate the shut down sequence. The audio interface module is designed with a graceful shutdown. What this means is that the current buffer is filled before stopping. This function will block while the last buffer is completing. The maximum blocking delay is a function of the configured DMA transfer size, and the word clock rate.

When this function returns it is recommended to complete processing of all pending ready buffers. If the caller is not interested in the last audio data it may simply call PDMCC26XX_I2S_requestBuffer() and PDMCC26XX_I2S_releaseBuffer() in a loop until PDMCC26XX_I2S_requestBuffer() returns false.
Will disable the I2S, disable all I2S interrupts and release the dependency on the corresponding power domain.

simplesect.para: PDMCC26XX_I2S_startStream() has to be called first.

parameterdescription.para: An I2S handle returned from PDMCC26XX_I2S_open()

simplesect.para: True if stream stopped successfully and false if not

detaileddescription.para: In PDMCC26XX_I2S_MODE_BLOCKING, PDMCC26XX_I2S_requestBuffer will block task execution until at least one buffer is ready.
In PDMCC26XX_I2S_CALLBACK_MODE, PDMCC26XX_I2S_requestBuffer returns immediately if no buffer is available. The caller is notified through events each time a buffer is available.

This function takes as an argument a pointer to a struct which contains 4 pointers. There are two pairs; one for Input and one for Output. If input is defined then the input buffer pointer will point to the new input buffer. Same goes for output and the output buffer pointer. The caller is not expected to allocate memory for the buffer as no copy is performed. The other two pointers must be maintained by the caller until it is ready to call PDMCC26XX_I2S_releaseBuffer().

simplesect.para: PDMCC26XX_I2S_open() and PDMCC26XX_I2S_startStream() has to be called first.

parameterdescription.para: A I2S handle returned from PDMCC26XX_I2S_open()

simplesect.para: True if a buffer is available, false if not.

detaileddescription.para: The caller of PDMCC26XX_I2S_requestBuffer() must call this function when it is finished working on the buffer. This function takes as an argument a pointer to a struct which contains two other pointers. These pointers must be set the pointers received in PDMCC26XX_I2S_requestBuffer().

simplesect.para: PDMCC26XX_I2S_requestBuffer() has to be called first.

parameterdescription.para: A I2S handle returned from PDMCC26XX_I2S_open()

simplesect.para: True if release is successful and false if not

briefdescription.para: PDM utility includes helper functions for configuring the CC26XX I2S controller.

detaileddescription.para: The PDMCC26XX utility header file should be included in an application as follows: #include<ti/drivers/pdm/PDMCC26XX_util.h>

This utility file is written specifically for the I2S module on CC26XX. The user should be aware that although this HW module is called I2S it is a highly configurable audio interface module. I2S is only one of many configurations.
